result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Need to verify with DOC any amounts due and owing.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (19 pages) commencing JUNE 30, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Parker C Mathers.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Corrections consecutive to underlying sentence/probation period in Count 3, with credit for 110 DAYS, with Huber Release for Mental Health treatment, and child visitation if approved by the BMCW. Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge during probation period on count 2, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS, consecutive to Count 3. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS consectuive to Count 3.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Cooperate with Children's Court and BMCW orders and programming.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by BMCW or Children's Court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge, from bail on deposit, during probation period, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-DOC Agent to contact the court to schedule probation review date for within 90 DAYS of release.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
**Court DENIED request for expugnment.


Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

ADDRESS INFO for Sharmika Renee Hickles
Current: 2420B N 1st Street, REAR UPPR, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 03-14-2014)
Prior: 2420B N 1st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Parker C Mathers.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion from the state, court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Parker C Mathers.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing prior to Jury Trial date. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in branch 23. Case remains set for Jury Trial in branch 23 on 6/9/2014.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Parker C. Mathers in court, defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Parker C. Mathers.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Case spun to Preliminary Hearing Court to address case on behalf of branch 23.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Amanda L., S.H. (DOB:  01/31/2013), Steven H. and Hansen Reno, Inc. (dba Brown Deer Sales).

Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Sharmika Renee Hickles in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
